description: India's gold reserves have surged past $100 billion for the first time, driven by soaring global prices. Why firecrackers are horrible for dogs
description: For millions of dogs, Diwali is not a festival of light. It is a night of noise and terror, a prolonged panic attack that no amount of comforting words can soothe. What we call tradition, they experience as trauma. And the reason lies not in weakness or over-sensitivity, but in the very biology that humans helped shape — a physiology honed over millennia for survival, now caught in a storm it cannot understand.

Exclusive | Sharad Kelkar reveals what he gifts his wife her every Dhanteras
description: Actor Sharad Kelkar is gearing up for Diwali, highlighting his wife Keerti as the 'light of his life' who simplifies his world. He revealed that Keerti selects her own Dhanteras gift, a tradition he meticulously plans for. Kelkar also emphasizes extending Diwali's joy and prosperity to his long-serving staff with bonuses and gifts, believing the festival signifies happiness for everyone.

title: Agarkar reveals why Shami missed Australia tour: 'We were desperate'
description: Former chief selector Ajit Agarkar cited fitness concerns for Mohammed Shami's exclusion from the England series and the recent Australia ODI tour. Shami, however, expressed his readiness to play, stating his participation in domestic matches indicates his fitness. Agarkar indicated that Shami's availability for future tours depends on his fitness over the next two months.

'Shameful decision!': Fans banned; Israeli fans attack British officials
description: British officials face pressure to reverse a ban on Maccabi Tel Aviv supporters attending a match at Aston Villa due to security concerns. Israel's foreign minister called the decision "shameful," while the UK Prime Minister emphasised zero tolerance for antisemitism. Police cited intelligence and previous violent incidents as reasons for the high-risk classification.

description: The Men's ODI Series between Australia and India has officially launched at Perth Stadium. Players from both nations gathered for a photo session, celebrating their historic cricket rivalry. The series begins on Saturday, October 19, at Perth Stadium. Over 175,000 tickets have already been sold for the white-ball series, indicating significant fan interest.

title: BBC Gaza documentary controversy: Why Ofcom called it a 'serious breach'
description: BBC has been found to have misled audiences by UK regulator Ofcom over its Gaza documentary. The 13-year-old narrator's father was a Hamas official, a crucial detail omitted. This ruling, a rare and serious rebuke, highlights transparency issues and has intensified scrutiny on the BBC's journalistic integrity in sensitive reporting.

title: Bihar polls: MGB misses 'deadline' for seat deal; does it spell big trouble?
description: Bihar's opposition Mahagathbandhan faces scrutiny over delayed seat-sharing talks, with the NDA appearing organized. Alliance leaders, however, insist the delay signifies expansion, not disarray, citing coordination complexities. Despite some candidate overlaps, leaders express confidence in forming a government, drawing parallels to past successful alliances.

2027 ODI WC? Head makes bold Kohli, Rohit future predictions
description: Australian cricketer Travis Head lauded Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma as premier white-ball talents, with Kohli hailed as the greatest. Head expressed admiration for Sharma's batting, seeing him as a role model for openers. Axar Patel echoed confidence in their readiness for the upcoming India-Australia series, highlighting their professional approach and recent strong performances.

Dhanteras 2025: Date, shubh muhurat to bring home Laxmi-Ganesh idols, broomsticks
description: Dhanteras, on October 18, 2025, marks the auspicious start of Diwali festivities, symbolizing the victory of light over darkness. Families traditionally buy gold, silver, and idols of Lakshmi and Ganesh, believed to invoke prosperity and remove obstacles. The day also involves rituals and purchasing broomsticks to sweep away negativity, setting a positive tone for the celebrations.

UPenn on Trump ‘compact’: Alma mater says no; chooses academic freedom over control
description: The University of Pennsylvania, Donald Trump’s alma mater, has rejected his administration’s “Compact for Academic Excellence,” a proposed funding-linked deal requiring tuition freezes, limits on international students, and protections for conservative speech. Joining MIT, Brown, and USC, UPenn cited academic freedom and autonomy concerns, marking a symbolic blow as Trump’s former university rebuffs his education policy.

Code Red at Google: ChatGPT beat Google; Sundar Pichai recalls
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai revealed an internal "code red" following OpenAI's ChatGPT launch, prompting founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin to return. The company dramatically reshaped its AI strategy, launching Bard (now Gemini) and reassigning over 20 AI initiatives to counter the existential threat to its search empire.

title: Dense forests no longer safe for Naxals; over 200 Maoists lay down arms
description: Over 200 Maoists, including key figures, surrendered in Chhattisgarh's Bastar, marking a significant turning point in the fight against Naxalism. Union Home Minister Amit Shah declared Abujhmarh and North Bastar free from Naxal terror, attributing the success to the government's dual approach of pressure and surrender incentives.

title: Spy games: The Chinese espionage case that is rocking UK govt - explained
description: A high-stakes legal battle is unfolding in Britain after a spying case against two Britons collapsed. Accused of espionage for China, the prosecution faltered on a technicality. This has sparked sharp criticism from intelligence chiefs and government officials who label China a significant threat. The incident raises crucial questions about national security and the UK's approach to China.

title: ‘Never gave anaesthesia’: Cops probe another woman's role in Bengaluru doctor’s murder
description: A surgical resident, Dr. Mahendra Reddy G S, has been arrested and remanded in custody for the alleged murder of his wife, dermatologist Dr. Kritika M Reddy. He is accused of administering an anaesthetic overdose, with forensic reports confirming the presence of Propofol in her viscera. Investigators are examining his motive and how he procured the drug.

title: Brewers ‘Karen’ fired after racist rant video IDs her as Shannon Kobylarczyk
description: A Wisconsin woman, Shannon Kobylarczyk, faced swift repercussions after a viral video captured her racist tirade against a U.S. war veteran at a baseball game. Her employer, ManPowerGroup, terminated her employment, and she resigned from the Make-A-Wish Foundation board. The incident highlights the rapid online response to displays of hate.

title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors eye $186M bucks star for big 3 with Curry, Butler
description: Golden State Warriors are reportedly considering a seismic trade, sending Draymond Green and other assets to Milwaukee for superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo. This bold move could redefine the franchise's future, potentially extending their championship window beyond the Stephen Curry era. The proposed deal offers a chance for a new era, balancing loyalty with a pursuit of generational talent.

title: Gwalior hospital: Worms found in govt-supplied kids’ Azithromycin syrup
description: In a startling turn of events, authorities in Madhya Pradesh have issued a statewide warning following the alarming discovery of worms in a government-provided antibiotic syrup intended for children. Health officials have immediately ceased the distribution of the implicated Azithromycin Oral Suspension and have launched an extensive investigation.

title: Happy Diwali 2025: Top 60 wishes, messages to light up the celebrations
description: Diwali, the festival of lights, is celebrated with great fervor, symbolizing hope, knowledge, and love. Families gather to share happiness, exchange gifts, and create lasting memories. The article provides 140+ wishes, messages, and quotes to help express gratitude and spread joy during this auspicious occasion.

title: Bezos' ex-wife cuts Amazon share; Slashes stake by $12.6bn; Increases charity
description: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, cutting holdings by nearly 42% to $12.6 billion. This reduction occurred despite Amazon's stock performance and follows her extensive philanthropic efforts, which have heavily focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. The exact reasons for the stake reduction, whether sales or donations, remain unspecified.

title: Zoho founder to take break; warns he’s at risk of ‘contradicting own principles’
description: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.
